summary: A multinational corporation (MNC) is a company that operates in multiple countries. It's not just about investing abroad; an MNC actively controls production or services in at least one foreign country. To be considered an MNC, a company typically gets a significant portion (at least 25%) of its revenue from international operations. Many of the world's biggest and most powerful companies, like those on the Forbes Global 2000 list, are MNCs.
title: Multinational corporation
